Close top ad Zergling (Legacy of the Void) ============================= From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see [Zergling (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Zergling_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Zergling (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") and [Zergling (Heart of the Swarm Campaign)](/starcraft2/Zergling_(Heart_of_the_Swarm_Campaign) "Zergling (Heart of the Swarm Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Zerg](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/Zerg_race_icon.png/30px-Zerg_race_icon.png%20%22Zerg%22) Zergling [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/4/49/SC2Zergling.jpg/600px-SC2Zergling.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Zergling.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/4/49/SC2Zergling.jpg/600px-SC2Zergling.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Zergling.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: Fast melee creature. Can morph into a Baneling. Speed")  17 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/02/Supply-zerg.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  0.5 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : Z Attack 1: Claws Targets: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/8/81/SC2ZerglingBurrowed.jpg/600px-SC2ZerglingBurrowed.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2ZerglingBurrowed.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/8/81/SC2ZerglingBurrowed.jpg/600px-SC2ZerglingBurrowed.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2ZerglingBurrowed.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 35 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Biological](/starcraft2/Biological "Biological") , [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") Sight: 4 Speed: Immobile Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.2 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.3 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Gallery](#Gallery) * [6 Quotes](#Quotes) * [7 Notes](#Notes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Zergling** is a small and fast melee attacker and the backbone of the [Zerg](/starcraft2/Zerg "Zerg") army. Individual Zerglings are weak, but large groups can surround and terrorize enemy ground forces. In such groups, they soak a lot of incoming damage and provide a shield for more expensive units. Zerglings are Tier 1 units and can be spawned early. They require only a [Spawning Pool](/starcraft2/Spawning_Pool "Spawning Pool") . Zergling rushes are an infamous early threat for which opponents must prepare. Two Zerglings hatch from a single [Cocoon](/starcraft2/Cocoon "Cocoon") , and each Zergling only uses one-half of a supply point. Once a [Baneling Nest](/starcraft2/Baneling_Nest "Baneling Nest") has been constructed, Zerglings can morph to [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") at any time. **[Metabolic Boost](/starcraft2/Metabolic_Boost "Metabolic Boost") ** (researched at the Spawning Pool) affords Zerglings the fastest ground movement speed in the game, and the second-fastest movement speed, period ([Interceptors](/starcraft2/Interceptor "Interceptor") are faster). When Metabolic Boost finishes, all of the player's Zerglings sprout wings. Once the upgrade is complete, the unit is typically referred to as a "Speedling" in the community. **[Adrenal Glands](/starcraft2/Adrenal_Glands "Adrenal Glands") ** boosts Zergling attack speed by 42.9%. Zerglings with Metabolic Boost are often referred to as _Speedlings_, and Zerglings with both upgrades are often referred to as _Cracklings_. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Morph to Baneling](/starcraft2/Morph_to_Baneling "Morph to Baneling") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/1/15/Baneling.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Baneling.gif) | **[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")
** 25

**[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")
** 25

:** 14 s

This ability morphs a [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling")
into a [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling")

attack cooldown to 0.35 (-0.15). Requires a [Hive](/starcraft2/Hive "Hive")

**Researched from:** [Spawning Pool](/starcraft2/Spawning_Pool "Spawning Pool")

Increases [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling")
movement speed by 60% to 6.58 (+2.45). | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Zerglings are produced in every Zerg match-up. If not used as part of an early rush or defense against early pressure, Zerglings are sent out across the map as scouts and early harassment. Later, Zerglings can force engagements by surrounding and trapping enemy units. They are also effective for counter-attackers, as they can be rushed into an opponent's base and deal heavy damage before the enemy can recall his forces or produce new units. The Metabolic Boost upgrade is considered essential in nearly all strategies, and it is often researched as early as possible. It is critical for effective use of Zerglings: Zerglings attack by surrounding their victims, body-blocking them into place, and tearing them to shreds. Obviously, this is more effective if the Zerglings can catch said victims. Further, it affords them the mobility for which they are known, making them effective scouts, rushers, sneak attackers, etc. The Adrenal Glands upgrade is usually researched when Zerg reaches [Hive](/starcraft2/Hive "Hive") if the Zerg has melee upgrades. Zerg players research it if they rely on counter-attacks to delay pushes and damage economy. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Zerglings don't scale well against [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") , because as soon as Zealots get the +1 attack upgrade, they can kill Zerglings in two hits (however, this can be offset with the +1 armor upgrade for Zerglings - which can be offset by the +2 attack for Zealots, and so on and so forth). As such, players seldom mass Zerglings early. However, against a Protoss rushing [Immortals](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") , or using a Stalker-centric build, Zerglings are the perfect counter unit. They can surround Immortals and Stalkers to deal heavy damage. [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") affords Immortals brief protection, but it doesn't last. Later, Zerglings can do run-bys against enemy bases. Protoss units are quite slow and may not reach their base in time to save it. Fully upgraded Zerglings deal high damage in the late game since they are cheap, spawn fast, and use minimal supply. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Zerglings are very effective in ZvT. With their improved AI, they can easily surround their targets. In the early game, Zerglings match up well against [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") . When combined with Banelings, Zerglings provide good cover by outrunning and surrounding the Marines and Marauders. This gives the Banelings the chance to reach and devastate the [Terran](/starcraft2/Terran "Terran") forces. Zerglings remain effective through the match-up, but if the Terran player uses [Hellions](/starcraft2/Hellion "Hellion") or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") , heavy use of Zerglings should be avoided because they melt to the area-of-effect flame attacks. Zerglings fare well against Mech play, because immobile Mech armies struggle with counter-attacks. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Zerglings are useful against Zerg for very early aggression, and they can punish an early-expanding Zerg. With the [Metabolic Boost](/starcraft2/Metabolic_Boost "Metabolic Boost") upgrade they can easily run past [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") and kill off [Drones](/starcraft2/Drone "Drone") or snipe isolated [Queens](/starcraft2/Queen "Queen") . Zerglings are less effective toward the midgame as Roaches come into play. Roaches have a lot of armor and at +1 attack they can kill Zerglings in two shots. As Roach numbers grow, the surface area of the army decreases, which renders swarms of Zerglings less efficient when surrounding a ball of roaches. However, because of the Zergling's high speed, they offer faster map control and scouting than Roaches. Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/b/b0/Zergling.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Zergling.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * [Zergling's sounds (video and sound)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSHUnEFDt-E) - YouTube video. Notes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Notes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/1/17/Lemonjuice.jpg/400px-Lemonjuice.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:Lemonjuice.jpg) [](/starcraft2/File:Lemonjuice.jpg "Enlarge") * Zerglings are allergic to lemon juice. In [Wings of Liberty](/starcraft2/Wings_of_Liberty "Wings of Liberty") , a news report mentions this; In [Heart of the Swarm](/starcraft2/Heart_of_the_Swarm "Heart of the Swarm") , Abathur mentions it if you idle at the Zergling upgrade screen in the Evolution Pit. * For players using the "Mutant" Zergling model (based on the [Swarmling](/starcraft2/SCUpgrade/Swarmling_Strain "SCUpgrade/Swarmling Strain") strain from the [Heart of the Swarm](/starcraft2/Heart_of_the_Swarm "Heart of the Swarm") campaign), available as a reward for reaching Zerg level 30, the model will gain double size wings and resemble the [Raptor](/starcraft2/SCUpgrade/Raptor_Strain "SCUpgrade/Raptor Strain") strain. Patch Changes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Zergling_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=11 "Edit section: Patch Changes")\ \] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | \[[hide](#)

Zergling (Legacy of the Void)

From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki


This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see Zergling (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm) and Zergling (Heart of the Swarm Campaign).
[e][h] Zergling

Ground Unit

Fast melee creature. Can morph into a Baneling.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Abilities
  • 3 Upgrades
  • 4 Competitive Usage
    • 4.1 Vs. Protoss
    • 4.2 Vs. Terran
    • 4.3 Vs. Zerg
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Quotes
  • 7 Notes
  • 8 Patch Changes
  • 9 References

Description[edit]

The Zergling is a small and fast melee attacker and the backbone of the Zerg army. Individual Zerglings are weak, but large groups can surround and terrorize enemy ground forces. In such groups, they soak a lot of incoming damage and provide a shield for more expensive units.

Zerglings are Tier 1 units and can be spawned early. They require only a Spawning Pool. Zergling rushes are an infamous early threat for which opponents must prepare.

Two Zerglings hatch from a single Cocoon, and each Zergling only uses one-half of a supply point. Once a Baneling Nest has been constructed, Zerglings can morph to Banelings at any time.

Metabolic Boost (researched at the Spawning Pool) affords Zerglings the fastest ground movement speed in the game, and the second-fastest movement speed, period (Interceptors are faster).

When Metabolic Boost finishes, all of the player's Zerglings sprout wings. Once the upgrade is complete, the unit is typically referred to as a "Speedling" in the community.

Adrenal Glands boosts Zergling attack speed by 42.9%. Zerglings with Metabolic Boost are often referred to as Speedlings, and Zerglings with both upgrades are often referred to as Cracklings.

Abilities[edit]

Morph to Baneling
25
25
Duration: 14 s
Hotkey: E
This ability morphs a Zergling into a Baneling. Requires a Baneling Nest.

Upgrades[edit]

Adrenal Glands
200
200
93
Hotkey: A
Researched from: Spawning Pool
Decreases Zergling attack cooldown to 0.35 (-0.15). Requires a Hive.
Metabolic Boost
100
100
79
Hotkey: M
Researched from: Spawning Pool
Increases Zergling movement speed by 60% to 6.58 (+2.45).

Competitive Usage[edit]

Zerglings are produced in every Zerg match-up. If not used as part of an early rush or defense against early pressure, Zerglings are sent out across the map as scouts and early harassment. Later, Zerglings can force engagements by surrounding and trapping enemy units. They are also effective for counter-attackers, as they can be rushed into an opponent's base and deal heavy damage before the enemy can recall his forces or produce new units.

The Metabolic Boost upgrade is considered essential in nearly all strategies, and it is often researched as early as possible. It is critical for effective use of Zerglings: Zerglings attack by surrounding their victims, body-blocking them into place, and tearing them to shreds. Obviously, this is more effective if the Zerglings can catch said victims. Further, it affords them the mobility for which they are known, making them effective scouts, rushers, sneak attackers, etc.

The Adrenal Glands upgrade is usually researched when Zerg reaches Hive if the Zerg has melee upgrades. Zerg players research it if they rely on counter-attacks to delay pushes and damage economy.

Vs. Protoss[edit]

Zerglings don't scale well against Zealots, because as soon as Zealots get the +1 attack upgrade, they can kill Zerglings in two hits (however, this can be offset with the +1 armor upgrade for Zerglings - which can be offset by the +2 attack for Zealots, and so on and so forth). As such, players seldom mass Zerglings early. However, against a Protoss rushing Immortals, or using a Stalker-centric build, Zerglings are the perfect counter unit. They can surround Immortals and Stalkers to deal heavy damage. Barrier affords Immortals brief protection, but it doesn't last. Later, Zerglings can do run-bys against enemy bases. Protoss units are quite slow and may not reach their base in time to save it. Fully upgraded Zerglings deal high damage in the late game since they are cheap, spawn fast, and use minimal supply.

Vs. Terran[edit]

Zerglings are very effective in ZvT. With their improved AI, they can easily surround their targets. In the early game, Zerglings match up well against Marines and Marauders. When combined with Banelings, Zerglings provide good cover by outrunning and surrounding the Marines and Marauders. This gives the Banelings the chance to reach and devastate the Terran forces. Zerglings remain effective through the match-up, but if the Terran player uses Hellions or Hellbats, heavy use of Zerglings should be avoided because they melt to the area-of-effect flame attacks. Zerglings fare well against Mech play, because immobile Mech armies struggle with counter-attacks.

Vs. Zerg[edit]

Zerglings are useful against Zerg for very early aggression, and they can punish an early-expanding Zerg. With the Metabolic Boost upgrade they can easily run past Roaches and kill off Drones or snipe isolated Queens. Zerglings are less effective toward the midgame as Roaches come into play. Roaches have a lot of armor and at +1 attack they can kill Zerglings in two shots. As Roach numbers grow, the surface area of the army decreases, which renders swarms of Zerglings less efficient when surrounding a ball of roaches. However, because of the Zergling's high speed, they offer faster map control and scouting than Roaches.

Gallery[edit]

Quotes[edit]

  • Zergling's sounds (video and sound) - YouTube video.

Notes[edit]

  • Zerglings are allergic to lemon juice. In Wings of Liberty, a news report mentions this; In Heart of the Swarm, Abathur mentions it if you idle at the Zergling upgrade screen in the Evolution Pit.
  • For players using the "Mutant" Zergling model (based on the Swarmling strain from the Heart of the Swarm campaign), available as a reward for reaching Zerg level 30, the model will gain double size wings and resemble the Raptor strain.

Patch Changes[edit]

[hide][show]Patch 4.7.1 [1]
  • Unburrow speed decreased from 0.71 to 0.36.
  • Unburrow random delay decreased from 0.36 to 0.08.

References[edit]

  1. ↑ Blizzard Entertainment (20 November 2018). "STARCRAFT II 4.7.1 PATCH NOTES". Battle.net.
